thread.title: More banks slash lending rates

author: tribuneindia.com
title: More banks slash lending rates
text:
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, October 1
Six public and private sector lenders — Allahabad Bank, SBBJ, SBoP, Yes Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank and ICICI Bank — today announced a cut in base rates that will bring down the cost of various kinds of loans. This comes soon after a substantial 0.50% cut in repo rate by the RBI on Tuesday. The banks who have cut rates so far include SBI, PNB, Bank of Baroda, Bank of India, Andhra Bank, IDBI Bank, Axis Bank and Oriental Bank of Commerce. “Kotak Mahindra Bank has reduced its base rate from the current level of 9.75% to 9.50% with effect from October 5, 2015,” the bank said in a filing to the BSE. All categories of loans (other than the exceptions permitted by the RBI) will be priced with reference to the revised base rate, it added. State Bank of Patiala has reduced its base rate by 30 basis points from October 5, 2015. ICICI Bank has cut lending rate by 0.35% to 9.35%.
